question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Be sure to provide executable code for demonstration. Help me create an animation explaining the principles of multilayer perceptron using HTML+CSS+JS. Focus only on the animation explanation.

checklist.title: Is the multilayer perceptron structure accurately visualized?
checklist.description: Review whether the code correctly renders the MLP architecture through HTML/CSS/JavaScript, including input layer, hidden layers, and output layer with proper node representation. Check if neuron connections (weights) are visually displayed with appropriate styling. Score 0 if basic network structure is missing, 5 if only simple nodes are shown without connections, and 10 if complete MLP topology with weighted connections is accurately represented.

checklist.title: Is the forward propagation process animated effectively?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the animation demonstrates signal flow from input to output layers, showing data transformation at each layer. Check if activation functions are visually represented and if the propagation timing is educational. Deduct 5 points if layer-by-layer processing is not shown, and 3 points if activation function visualization is missing. Full score requires clear step-by-step forward pass animation.

checklist.title: Are the mathematical concepts properly illustrated?
checklist.description: Check whether key MLP principles are visually explained: weighted sum calculations, bias addition, and activation function application. Evaluate if mathematical formulas are displayed alongside animations. Deduct 5 points if weight multiplication is not visualized, 3 points if bias terms are ignored, and 5 points if activation functions lack mathematical representation. Full implementation scores 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the educational flow and interaction design comprehensive?
checklist.description: Assess whether the animation provides educational value with proper pacing, step controls, and explanatory text. Check for features like play/pause, step-by-step mode, and parameter adjustment capabilities. Deduct 5 points if no user controls are provided, 3 points if explanatory text is insufficient, and 5 points if the learning progression is unclear. Award full points for comprehensive educational experience.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as invalid input values, animation state conflicts, browser compatibility issues, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the learning experience (e.g., 1. Real-time parameter tweaking with instant visual feedback 2. Multiple dataset examples with different behaviors 3. Interactive weight adjustment sliders 4. Comparative visualization of different activation functions). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant animation logic or duplicate visual elements 2. Function modules unrelated to MLP explanation (e.g., unrelated mathematical concepts) 3. Overly complex effects that distract from learning (e.g., excessive particle effects or decorative animations). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core educational purpose is interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating animation logic/rendering/mathematical computation), code organization, and maintainability. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or proper class/module structure is not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 3 points if inconsistent coding style is observed. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern educational visualization principles: 1) Harmonious color coding for different layer types (no more than 4 primary colors) 2) Proper spacing and proportions for network visualization 3) Professional typography for mathematical notation and labels (font size ≥ 14px, clear mathematical symbols). Deduct 3 points for each cluttered visual element, 5 points for poor color contrast affecting readability, and 5 points for unclear mathematical notation. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the animation effects conform to educational presentation standards: 1) Smooth transitions between animation states ≤ 300ms delay 2) Animation duration appropriate for learning (2-5 seconds per forward pass) 3) Clear visual focus and highlighting of active components. Deduct 5 points for each jarring transition, 3 points for animations too fast to follow educationally, and 5 points for unclear visual emphasis on active network components. The full score is 10 points.
